Catalog_Raisonne: Ukiyo-e shūka 14 (1981), Hiroshige list, p. 240, chūtanzaku #10.05
creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription:
Omoshiro ki/ sakura no ato no/ mukuge-bana (How delightful!/ Just after cherry blosssoms have gone/ here comes magnolia flower.)

Poem: Omoshiroki/ sakura no ato ya/ mokuren ka おもしろき　桜のあとや　木蓮花 (From Museum of Fine Arts website)
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e), ink and color on paper
portfolio: Untitled series of pictures of flowers and birds with poem in chūtanzaku
title: Finch on Magnolia Branch
